thread.title_full: Carmen Miranda celebrated with a Google doodle – in pictures | Technology | The Guardian

author: Joanna Ruck
title: Carmen Miranda celebrated with a Google doodle – in pictures | Technology | The Guardian
text:
Carmen Miranda celebrated with a Google doodle – in pictures Carmen Miranda celebrated with a Google doodle – in pictures View more sharing options Share on Messenger Close 
Internet giant commemorates the queen of headdresses to mark her 108th birthday. We look back at some of her best moments Thursday 9 February 2017 11.43 GMT Google’s doodle celebrating Carmen Miranda’s 108th birthday Photograph: Google Carmen Miranda was a Brazilian samba singer, dancer and actor. This still from Down Argentine Way, 1940, was Miranda’s first film Photograph: 20th Century Fox/Rex/Shutterstock Still from That Night in Rio, 1941. She starred in 14 Hollywood films Photograph: Everett/Rex/Shutterstock Carmen Miranda, 1947. Miranda started out as a samba singer and soon became one of Brazil’s most popular stars Photograph: Everett/Rex/Shutterstock Miranda in Hollywood in 1948 Photograph: Everett/Rex/Shutterstock A still from the film Doll Face, 1951 Photograph: SNAP/Rex/Shutterstock Miranda became famous for the signature fruit hat outfit she wore in her American films, especially in The Gang’s All Here, 1943 Photograph: Faherty/20th Century Fox/Rex/Shutterstock By 1945 Miranda was the highest-paid woman in America Photograph: Moviestore/Rex/Shutterstock Miranda also performed in nightclubs and on TV variety shows Photograph: 20th Century Fox/Rex/Shutterstock Miranda decided to produce her own film, Copacabana, opposite Groucho Marx in 1947 Photograph: Snap/Rex/Shutterstock Carmen Miranda died in 1955 aged 46 and will forever be remembered for her headdresses Photograph: Bettmann/Bettmann Archive
